access_scores_primcare:primcare_cnt.short_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations
access_scores_primcare:primcare_cnt.long_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations. Address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
access_scores_primcare:primcare_cnt.statement: There are {value} primary care physicians in {features.name}.

access_scores_primcare:primcare_2sfca.long_name: Primary care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
access_scores_primcare:primcare_2sfca.short_description: Index of primary care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
access_scores_primcare:primcare_2sfca.long_description: Primary care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
access_scores_primcare:primcare_2sfca.statement: The primary care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

access_scores_primcare:primcare_e2sfca.long_name: Primary care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
access_scores_primcare:primcare_e2sfca.short_description: Index of primary care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
access_scores_primcare:primcare_e2sfca.long_description: Primary care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
access_scores_primcare:primcare_e2sfca.statement: The primary care availability for {features.name} is {value}.
